discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
replacing just one drive with an SSD in a RAID 5 array will not guarantee an increase in performance because the overall performance is limited by the slowest drive in the array

questions.question_text: A network technician is replacing a failed drive in a RAID 5 array. Over time, access to the volumes in the array has slowed down. The technician wants to increase the speed of the RAID array and chooses to replace the 10000rpm SAS drive with a low-latency SSD drive. Which of the following is the problem with this solution?

choices.D: All the drives in the RAID array must be replaced simultaneously
choices.A: SSD drives cannot be used in RAID arrays
choices.C: SAS drives are faster due to their high spindle speed

questions.question_text: A systems administrator backs up company data to the public cloud as part of a disaster recovery plan. Which of the following BEST describes this replication method?

An administrator is installing a new OS on a brand new server. The administrator cannot bring a monitor or keyboard into the datacenter. Which of the following is the administrator MOST likely to use to configure the OS?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
RDP requires OS so can't be the rigth answer with given scenario

Selected Answer: C
D still have a single point of failure with just single HA PSU

questions.question_text: The BEST way for a technician to configure a server rack for full power redundancy is:

choices.B: multiple PDUs each attached to a single UPS
choices.A: a single PDU attached to a single UPS
choices.D: multiple PDUs attached to a high availability UPS
choices.C: multiple PDUs each attached to separate UPSs

discussion.content: its Exchange Server 2013 enterprise, Answer is correct, setup to throw you off
